paragraph.paragraph: The search facilities provided by Visual Studio .NET's ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfObjectBrowserS.htmObject Browser are fully supported by EiffelEnvision projects. Searching for "objects" in the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfObjectBrowserS.htmObject Browser is done via the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfFindObjectDialogBoxS.htmFind Symbols dialog. For more information on searching the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfObjectBrowserS.htmObject Browser, see ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxtskSearchingObjectsS.htmSearching for Symbols: Objects, Definitions and References.

After performing a search the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfFindObjectResultsWindowS.htmFind Symbol Results Window will be opened, if not already so. The results window will show the complete results of a performed search based on your specified search options and parameters. In order to navigate to a corresponding symbol, double-left click on the item in the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfFindObjectResultsWindowS.htmFind Symbol Results Window. The index.xmlObject Browser or a corresponding document will be opened, in the editor, at the appropriate location.
